Translations.Text: By the fig and the olive
and by Mount Sinai
and by this trustworthy land
truly, We have created the human being of the fairer symmetry
Again, We returned him to the lowest of the low
But those who believed and did as the ones in accord with morality, for them is compensation, that which is unfailing
What will cause thee to deny the Judgment after that
Is not God The Most Just of ones who judge
Recite in the Name of thy Lord Who created
He created the human being from a clot
Recite: Thy Lord is the Most Generous
He Who taught by the pen
He taught the human being what he knows not
No indeed! The human being is, truly, defiant
He considered himself self-sufficient
Truly, to thy Lord is the returning
Hast thou thyself considered he who prohibits
a servant when he invoked blessings
Hast thou considered if he had been on guidance
or commanded God-consciousness
Hast thou considered if he denied and turned away
Knows he not that God sees
No indeed! Truly, if he refrains himself not, We will, surely, lay hold of him by the forelock
a lying, inequitable forelock
And let him call to his conclave
We will call to the guards of hell
No indeed! Truly, obey thou him not but prostrate thyself to God and be near to Him.â€¡
